Employees in all business operating divisions who have contact with taxpayers inquiring about an innocent issue.
With Taxpayer Contact
) Purpose: This IRM section provides general guidance for employees who have contact with taxpayers who may inquire about innocent spouse relief. (
) Audience: Employees in all business divisions who have contact with taxpayers who may inquire about innocent spouse relief. (
) Policy Owner: The policy owner is the SB/SE Director, Exam - Field and Campus Policy. (
) Program Owner: The program owner is SB/SE Campus Exam and Field Support. (

) Program Goals: The program goals are to properly inform taxpayers regarding provisions available for innocent spouse relief, route requests for innocent spouse relief, and advise taxpayers of the effects of applying for innocent spouse relief to collection matters, including the suspension of the statute of limitations for collection. (
) This IRM provides general guidance to employees to use when answering taxpayer inquiries regarding innocent spouse relief provisions. (
) Married taxpayers may elect to ﬁle joint returns with their spouse per IRC
Married taxpayers who ﬁle joint returns under

: a. Have joint and several liability with respect to the income tax liability. b. Are responsible for the accuracy and completeness of the return. c. Are responsible for the payment of the income tax liability reported on return as well as any deﬁciency (additional tax), penalties, additions tax, and interest. (
) Taxpayers who ﬁle a joint return may elect to seek relief from joint and liability under IRC
from income tax liability, as well as penalties, to tax, and interest, per the relief provisions enacted in the Revenue ation Act of
(RRA
). See IRM
, Technical Provisions of IRC
, for more information. (
) Taxpayers who are subject to community property laws may also be from liability under certain conditions per IRC
See IRM
, Relief Community Property Laws, for more information. (

Purpose: This IRM section provides general guidance for employees who have contact with taxpayers who may inquire about innocent spouse relief.
This IRM provides general guidance to employees to use when answering taxpayer inquiries regarding innocent spouse relief provisions.

) The Director, Examination - Field and Campus Policy, reports to the Headquarters Examination, and is responsible for the delivery of policy and guidance that impacts the ﬁeld and campus examination process. See IRM
, Field and Campus Policy, for additional information. (

) Campus Exam and Field Support reports to the Director, Examination - and Campus Policy, is the group responsible for providing Servicewide guidance on compliance processes that relate to campus examination tions, and support Field Exam and Specialty programs in SB/SE and Large Business & International (LB&I). See IRM
, Campus Exam Field Support, for additional information. (

) All employees with taxpayer contact may receive inquiries about innocent spouse relief, and should be able to advise such taxpayers of their rights, to ﬁle a request for relief, and the effects of such a request on various tion scenarios. See IRM
, Introduction, and Pub
, Innocent Relief, for more information. (

) Management officials in the Area Offices and Campuses oversee the employees who may receive such inquiries, and must ensure the proper mation regarding innocent spouse relief requests is provided. (

) If during a taxpayer contact it appears that a hardship situation may exist, the taxpayer’s issue cannot be resolved the same day, refer taxpayers to Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) when TAS criteria are met. See IRM Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) Case Criteria, and IRM
, Advocate Service (TAS) Guidelines, for more information. Note: The deﬁnition of “same day” is within
hours. “Same day” cases cases that can be resolved completely within
hours, as well as cases which steps have been taken within
hours to begin resolution of the payer’s issue. Do not refer “same day” cases to TAS unless the taxpayer asks to be transferred to TAS and the case meets TAS criteria. Refer to
, Same Day Resolution by Operations, for more information. you refer cases to TAS, use Form
, Request for Taxpayer Advocate Service Assistance (And Application for Taxpayer Assistance order), and forward to TAS. (

The deﬁnition of “same day” is within
hours. “Same day” cases include cases that can be resolved completely within
hours, as well as cases in which steps have been taken within
hours to begin resolution of the tax- payer’s issue. Do not refer “same day” cases to TAS unless the taxpayer asks to be transferred to TAS and the case meets TAS criteria. Refer to
, Same Day Resolution by Operations, for more information. When you refer cases to TAS, use Form
, Request for Taxpayer Advocate Service Assistance (And Application for Taxpayer Assistance order), and forward to TAS.

Innocent spouse claim, or request for innocent spouse relief - A request for innocent spouse relief ﬁled on Form 8857, Request for Innocent Spouse or a written statement containing the same information required on the Form 8857, which is signed under penalties of perjury.
Procedures/Employees With Taxpayer Contact 25.15.2 page
The following table lists commonly used acronyms and their deﬁnitions used throughout this IRM:

Acronym Deﬁnition NMF Non-Master File - a database that contains tax account information that cannot be contained on Master File Tax. NRS Non-Requesting Spouse - the spouse not making a request for innocent spouse relief. RS Requesting Spouse - the spouse making the request for innocent spouse relief. TAS Taxpayer Advocate Service - an independent organization within the IRS that helps taxpayers resolve problems with the IRS and recommends changes that will prevent future problems. See IRM 13, Taxpayer Advocate Service, for more information. TC Transaction Code - codes that are used on taxpayer accounts to indicate certain actions and activi- ties. TIN Taxpayer Identiﬁcation Number - most commonly the taxpayer’s individual Social Security Number.
independent organization within the IRS that helps taxpayers resolve problems with the IRS and recommends changes that will prevent future problems. See IRM
, Taxpayer Advocate Service, for more information.

Other IRM chapters provide information on single topics that pertain to more than one function. Compliance employees are responsible for researching and utilizing information contained in all reference materials. ) If the taxpayer elects to ﬁle a Form

and has an installment agreement effect, he or she must decide whether or not to continue making installment Agreements payments while the request for relief is considered. Inform the taxpayer of following consequences: a. If the requesting spouse (RS) does not continue to make installment payments, the taxpayer may be in default of the installment See IRM

, Reasons for Proposing Termination (Defaulting) of Installment Agreements, for more information. The Service may a RS’s installment agreement that is in default, but cannot collect on tax liability while the request for relief is being considered, and for

days after the request for relief is denied. If the request for relief is denied and the case has become ﬁnal, the Service may resort to its normal collection procedures in order to collect the tax liability in full. Treas. Reg.

(c) for more information. If RS does not continue make installment payments and relief is granted, the Service will not pursue collection to the extent that relief is granted. b. If the RS continues to make installment payments and relief is RS should continue to make installment payments under the (

If the requesting spouse (RS) does not continue to make installment payments, the taxpayer may be in default of the installment agreement. See IRM

, Reasons for Proposing Termination (Defaulting) of Installment Agreements, for more information. The Service may a RS’s installment agreement that is in default, but cannot collect on the tax liability while the request for relief is being considered, and for

days after the request for relief is denied. If the request for relief is denied and the case has become ﬁnal, the Service may resort to its normal collection procedures in order to collect the tax liability in full. See Treas. Reg.

(c) for more information. If RS does not continue to make installment payments and relief is granted, the Service will not pursue collection to the extent that relief is granted. If the RS continues to make installment payments and relief is denied, RS should continue to make installment payments under the installment
If the RS continues to make installment payments and relief is denied, RS should continue to make installment payments under the
25.15 Relief from Joint and Several Liability
agreement until the installment agreement ends by its terms or is super- seded by a new installment agreement. If the RS continues to make installment payments and relief is granted under IRC
(b) or IRC
(f), the taxpayer may be entitled to a refund of these payments. See IRC
(g) for more information. If the RS continues to make installment payments and the request for relief is granted under IRC
(c), the taxpayer will not be entitled to a refund. IRC

If the RS appeals Tax Court decision and does not post an appeal bond, the Service is no longer prohibited from resuming collection. Thus, the suspension of the CSED will end

days after the ﬁling of a notice of appeal without an bond. Although the Service may resume collection, a policy decision has been made not to collect in these circumstances unless the collection is about to expire or collection is in jeopardy. See IRC

should not be input. Because there is no way to indicate on a tax module that collection should not occur while letting the CSED run, Counsel will inform the Headquarters Innocent Spouse policy analyst of cases where the RS appealed the Tax Court. Relief from Joint and Several Liability

When the innocent spouse claim is resolved and it is the only issue, input TC 131 to reverse the TC 130. TC 131 reverses all TC 130, therefore additional research and caution is needed when more than one TC 130 is present. See IRM 25.15.9.2(5), for more information.
Caution: If there are two TC 130, research to ensure you do not reverse the 130 if there is another reason for the TC 130.

Determinations on all requests for relief assigned to Area Office all business divisions, will be made by the Compliance function. Whenever possible, the same examiner will make the determination for years for which relief is requested on Form
See IRM
, amination Procedures, for more information. Innocent Spouse relief requests received by the Service that are not to Area Office employees are processed and worked in CCISO using the cedures in IRM

, Innocent Spouse Relief Processing related IRMs. CCISO employees use the Integrated Data Retrieval System (IDRS) code “ESTAB,” with modiﬁer “V” to expedite the request for an original For additional information on this command code, see Document
, Processing Codes and Information.
Determinations on all requests for relief assigned to Area Office employees in all business divisions, will be made by the Compliance function.
Area Office Determinations on Requests for Relief
Whenever possible, the same examiner will make the determination for all years for which relief is requested on Form
See IRM
, Field Ex- amination Procedures, for more information.

CCISO employees use the Integrated Data Retrieval System (IDRS) command code “ESTAB,” with modiﬁer “V” to expedite the request for an original return. For additional information on this command code, see Document 6209, IRS Processing Codes and Information.
